title: Mazzei 2013 Castello Fonterutoli Gran  Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla, exotic spice and espresso follow over to the medium-bodied, linear palate along with cranberry, licorice, chopped mint and coconut. Racy acidity and austere, fine-grained tannins provide balance and support. Drink 2019–2028.

title: Negretti 2013 Mirau  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of pressed blue flower, perfumed berry, dried herb and exotic spice are in the forefront. The vibrant, linear palate delivers dried black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and a hint of coffee set against taut, fine-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2033.

title: Nelle 2015 Maniacal G-S-M (Paso Robles)
description: There are loads of sagebrush, thyme, peppercorn and dried oregano aromas on this blend of 50% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre, all set against a baked boysenberry frame. The mouthfeel is easygoing and airy, with flavors of tart berry, plum skins and more garden herbs. A peppery spice extends through the finish.

title: Oakville East 2014 Harter Family Double H Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: A tiny production wine from a backbone site, used in many of the producer's other wines, this is brash in coconut and black currant, the tannins grainy and firm, given additional heft by the ripeness and generous use of oak. Velvety smooth, it's densely packed in black pepper and clove.

title: Paris Valley Road 2014 Merlot (California)
description: Mint and violet notes accent a dense black-cherry core in this full-bodied, juicy wine. Light touches of baking spices and dried herbs add complexity and play into a layering effect on the palate.

title: Patrick Tranchand 2015 Roche Grès  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: While this wine is tough and closed up at this stage, it has good potential. The weight shows it has plenty of ripe fruit while wood aging has added spice. The wine needs time, so drink from 2019.

title: Poggio al Sole 2014 Casasilia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of underbrush, pipe tobacco and balsamic notes emerge in the glass. It's full-bodied and elegant, with mature Maresca cherry, dried plum and dark culinary spice framed in polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2024.

title: Prunotto 2014  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of wild berry, tilled soil, new leather, camphor and a whiff of violet take center stage on the nose. Bright and succulent, the vibrant, graceful palate doles out juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry and baking spice. Taut, refined tannins and racy acidity lend balance and tension. Fans of elegance will love its ethereal finesse. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Ron Rubin 2016 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: With a waxy nose of peach and apricot—both dried and fresh—this is a dry, light-bodied wine that dances on the palate in moderately high acidity. Fermented entirely in stainless steel, it remains softly textured and vibrant from start to finish.

title: Steven Kent 2014 BDX Collection Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a beautifully balanced wine with medium body and nicely firm tannins supporting fairly rich black fruits and herbal accents. It is sleek and agile rather than big and rich, and its appetizing texture should make it really versatile at lunch or dinner.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Earthy aromas of pepper spice, roasted meat crust and red cherry sauce show on the nose of this bottling from a new property in Ojai. The flavors are clean yet pleasantly rustic, full of cooked herbs, dust and rounded cranberry. It's light in body, soft in texture and easy to drink.

title: Undurraga 2014 T.H. Terroir Hunter Carignan (Maule Valley)
description: While this displays dark aromas of burnt oak, road tar and blackberry, the palate is not heavy or overly hard driving. Plum and berry flavors are loaded with wood spice and nutmeg accents, while this tastes chocolaty on a bold finish. Drink this exemplary Carignan through 2025.

title: Vignamaggio 2013 Mona Lisa Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Menthol, mature black-skinned fruit, clove, pressed violet and balsamic aromas take shape in the glass. The linear, elegantly structured palate is youthfully austere, offering tart red cherry, cranberry and licorice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Give this time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2020–2033.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2016 Force de Fleurs White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache Blanc and 45% Viognier is one of the zippiest white wines you can find. It's restrained on the nose with honeydew, yellow grapefruit peel and wet slate aromas, and then the wound-up acidic power explodes on the sip, where tart apple and pear flavors linger behind the sizzle.

title: Claire & Fabien Chasselay 2016  Moulin-à-Vent
description: This brother-and-sister team have produced a structured wine as part of their négociant business (they also have a family domaine). Packed with red-cherry fruits and acidity, this wine is young but promises a good future. The crisp texture and the tannins will keep the wine developing until 2019.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 Todd Brothers Ranch Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Peppery, this old-vine wine is well integrated and thickly restrained, with a lip-smacking taste of blackberry cobbler and dark chocolate. Gritty tannins give it texture and ample weight, while a freshness of acidity persists.

title: Cecchi 2015 Valore di Famiglia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather. The juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, clove, licorice and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.

title: Cedarville Vineyard 2014 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Healthy doses of black pepper and smoked meat in both the aromas and the flavors give this wine a pretty forceful personality, and it has good fruit to back them up. It smells like cracked pepper and cedar, tastes spicy, meaty, quite firm in texture and brings out raspberry and red cherry on the finish.

title: Domaine de Nalys 2015 Eicelènci White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Fresh lemon acidity invigorates this glossy, unctuous white wine. Full bodied and fleshy on the palate, it offers soft red apple, grapefruit and hazelnut flavors accented by a hint of dried herb.

title: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée les Roches  (Morgon)
description: Named after the rocky soil of the vineyard, this wine is suitably firm and structured. A mineral texture gives an edgy character and enhances the firm tannins. The wine, rich in fruit potential, will age well. Drink from 2019.

title: Château de Fleurie 2016  Fleurie
description: This bold, ripe wine is packed with rich fruit and tannins. It is produced by direct descendants of the Loron family of négociants who still run the estate. With its dense texture and rich concentration, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Cambiata 2016 Albariño (Monterey)
description: This is extremely racy wine that starts with clean chalky aromas of apple skins and Meyer lemon pith will pair excellently with fresh raw shellfish. The tightly wound palate clings to the tongue with a limestone-like grip, delivering flavors of Asian pear flesh, yuzu zest, oyster shell and tons of wet gravel.

title: Alma de Cattleya 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is a great taste of the freshness of Sonoma without the sticker shock, showing freshly pressed red berries, vanilla and wet slate on the nose. It's light in density on the sip, so the flavors of cranberry, carnation, wet earth and brown spice sail effortlessly across the palate.

title: Aresti 2012 Codigo de Familia Red (Curicó Valley)
description: Dense dark aromas of road tar, eucalyptus, blackberry, tea and barrel spice are Chilean through and through. Aresti's 65th anniversary blend is dry, oaky and intense on the palate. Woody creamy berry flavors are robust as this finishes oaky, spicy and fleshy.

title: Ata Rangi 2015 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: This wine is brooding in aromas of dark fruit, earth, cola, chocolate, dried herbs and a whiff of smoke that carry to a toasty, medium-bodied palate, leading to a medicinal, herbal and oaky finish. The structure and fine tannins of this wine suggest it will age into something quite lovely. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Bella Grace 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Attractive and focused raspberry and black-cherry flavors fill out this medium-bodied wine. The aromas are fruity, with touches of clove and cinnamon, while the flavors are clean, pure and delicious. The wine has just enough tannin to firm up the texture, along with good acidity for balance. Drink now or hold through 2022.

title: Bevela 2014 Unforeseen Alchemy Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Thick and hearty aromas of elderberry and blueberry jam meet with lilacs and black pepper on the rich and spicy nose of this blend of 50% Syrah and 50% Teroldego. The sip is dense and attention-grabbing, with strong blackberry and boysenberry flavors alongside loamy soil and chalky tannins.

title: Brassfield 2015 Grenache (High Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine has a big structure, strong oak, spice and red fruit flavors all wrapped in fine-grained tannins. The color is relatively light, but the aromas are full of toasted oak and nutmeg while the flavors have vivid cranberry and cherry. The wine should mellow with age, and will be best after 2020.

title: Bailarin 2015 Love Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is thick and sinewy, ripe and soft in texture. Spicy clove, pepper and cinnamon highlight a richness of strawberry puree and mocha chocolate flavor, the oak subdued in the background.

title: Laura Hartwig 2014 Edición de Familia Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Licorice, olive, cherry cough drop and cassis aromas lay the framework for a flush chewy wine that includes descending amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Toasty flavors of blackberry, coffee and mocha are peppery, spicy and dry on a solid finish. Drink through 2022.
